alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Hamblen; Jefferson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 6:37PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Cocke, Hamblen and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport, White Pine, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Bybee, Hartford, Chestnut Hill, Cosby, Del Rio, Lowland, Round Mountain and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
